case_vignette: A 44-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-week history of productive cough, fever, and lethargy. He also has several skin lesions over his body. His symptoms began 3 weeks after he returned from a camping trip in Kentucky. Three years ago, he underwent kidney transplantation for polycystic kidney disease. Current medications include sirolimus and prednisone. His temperature is 38°C (100.4°F). Diffuse crackles are heard over the lung fields. There are 4 white, verrucous skin patches over his chest and upper limbs. A photomicrograph of a skin biopsy specimen from one of the lesions is shown.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing a productive cough, fever, and feeling very tired for the past three weeks.
How old are you?
I am 44 years old.
Do you have any medical conditions or take any medications regularly?
Yes, I had a kidney transplant three years ago and I take sirolimus and prednisone.
Do you have any family history of lung disease or infections?
The case vignette does not provide information about my family history of lung disease or infections.
Based on your symptoms and medical history, it seems like you may have a weakened immune system. Have you been in contact with anyone who has been sick recently?
No, but I returned from a camping trip in Kentucky three weeks ago when my symptoms started.
**Final Diagnosis:** Pneumocystis pneumonia
